p: Many viruses are capable of reinfecting a host. This may be due to the waning of host immunity over time, as with respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) [ 49], or due to viral evolution for immune escape (e.g., with norovirus [ 50] and influenza) [ 51, 52]: see Sect. 6 for a more in-depth treatment of the latter. In either case, the overall dynamical effect is for recovered, immune individuals to eventually reenter the susceptible pool, as illustrated by Fig. 5.8a.
